= Use fd with fzf =
fzf by default uses the find command to look for files and directories.

Letâ€™s replace that with fd for better functionality, like ignoring files ignored by git (with .gitignore).

Install fd:

------------------------------------------------------------------------
brew install fd
------------------------------------------------------------------------
or if you use debian
------------------------------------------------------------------------
sudo apt install -y fd-find
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Open ~/.zshrc with preferred text editor.

Add to the bottom of this file:


# -- Use fd instead of fzf --
add your .zshrc
------------------------------------------------------------------------
export FZF_DEFAULT_COMMAND="fd --hidden --strip-cwd-prefix --exclude .git"
export FZF_CTRL_T_COMMAND="$FZF_DEFAULT_COMMAND"
export FZF_ALT_C_COMMAND="fd --type=d --hidden --strip-cwd-prefix --exclude .git"

# Use fd (https://github.com/sharkdp/fd) for listing path candidates.
# - The first argument to the function ($1) is the base path to start traversal
# - See the source code (completion.{bash,zsh}) for the details.
_fzf_compgen_path() {
  fd --hidden --exclude .git . "$1"
}

# Use fd to generate the list for directory completion
_fzf_compgen_dir() {
  fd --type=d --hidden --exclude .git . "$1"
}
After saving, in your terminal do:

------------------------------------------------------------------------

source ~/.zshrc
------------------------------------------------------------------------
